definition: don't insist on only taking one road to Rome (idiom)/there's more than one way to skin a cat
pinyin: bu4 yao4 zai4 yi1 ke1 shu4 shang4 diao4 si3

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
classifier for trees, cabbages, plants etc
tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
there are plenty more fish in the sea (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 ya2 he2 chu4 wu2 fang1 cao3

definition: lit. a good horse doesn't turn around and graze the same patch again (idiom)/fig. once you've moved on, don't go back again (romantic relationship, job etc)/leave the past behind
pinyin: hao3 ma3 bu4 chi1 hui2 tou2 cao3

definition: lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: better a bad life than a good death (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 si3 bu4 ru2 lai4 huo2 zhe5

definition: to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: to end one's suffering by dying quickly and being reincarnated/(fig.) to get it over with
Failure is the mother of success.
pinyin: shi1 bai4 shi4 cheng2 gong1 zhi1 mu3

definition: to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
if it isn't bright in the east, it'll be bright in the west (idiom)/if something doesn't work here, it might work somewhere else
pinyin: dong1 fang1 bu4 liang4 xi1 fang1 liang4

definition: better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
lit. to search for the mule while riding on it (idiom)/fig. to look for what one already has
a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 bi4 you3 lu4
